Now map in shiny.

```{r}
library(shiny)
library(leaflet)
library(dplyr)
# library(htmltools)

# Data
sites_grouped <- sites %>%
  select(Locality, Latitude, Longitude) %>%
  distinct(Locality, Latitude, Longitude)

# ui
ui <- fluidPage(
  sliderInput(inputId = "time",
              label = "Thousands of years Before Present:",
              min = 0, max = 800, value = c(0, 800), step = 5), # 2 values for a range slider
  leafletOutput(outputId = "MapPlot1")#), width = "100%", height = "100%")
)

# server
server <- function(input, output) {
  
  # Leaflet map
  output$MapPlot1 <- renderLeaflet({
    leaflet() %>%
    addProviderTiles("CartoDB.Positron") %>% 
    setView(lng = 15, lat = 55, zoom = 3) %>%
    addCircleMarkers(data = sites_grouped, 
                     lat = ~Latitude, lng = ~Longitude,
                     radius = 4,
                     weight = 1,
                     fillOpacity = 0.6,
                     popup = ~as.character(Locality))

  })
  
  # Slider inputs
  observeEvent({
    min_age <- input$time[[1]]
    max_age <- input$time[[2]]
    
    sites_selection <- sites %>% 
      filter(Min_age >= min_age | Max_age >= min_age) %>% 
      filter(Max_age <= max_age | Min_age <= max_age) 

    leafletProxy("MapPlot1") %>% clearMarkers() %>%
        addCircleMarkers(lng = sites_selection$Longitude,
          lat = sites_selection$Latitude,
          popup = as.character(sites_selection$Locality)
        )
    
# ?
# Need to query sites within age range
# And then display each assemblage present, even when >1 assemblage per site
   })
  
}

shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)
```
